unnormalised: New Delhi continues to grapple with air quality concerns, particularly during the post-Diwali season. The Centre for Science and Environment (CSE) recently published a report highlighting the persisting challenges despite efforts to curb emissions. The report indicated a spike in PM2.5 levels exceeding national standards.
normalised: New Delhi continues to grapple with air quality concerns, particularly during the post-Diwali season. The Centre for Science and Environment (C S E) recently published a report highlighting the persisting challenges despite efforts to curb emissions. The report indicated a spike in P M two point five levels exceeding national standards.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, a leading environmental scientist at IIT Kanpur, emphasizes that agricultural stubble burning in neighbouring states like Punjab and Haryana remains a significant contributor. Wind patterns, especially during the winter months (October to January), trap pollutants, exacerbating the situation.
normalised: Doctor Sharma, a leading environmental scientist at I I T Kanpur, emphasizes that agricultural stubble burning in neighbouring states like Punjab and Haryana remains a significant contributor. Wind patterns, especially during the winter months (October to January), trap pollutants, exacerbating the situation.

unnormalised: The National Clean Air Programme (NCAP), launched in 2019, aims to reduce PM2.5 and PM10 concentrations by 20-30% by 2024, using 2017 as the base year. However, progress has been uneven. Authorities are urging citizens to avoid bursting firecrackers and use public transport whenever possible. A meeting is scheduled on 10/11/2024 at 11:00 hrs to discuss further measures. The Air Quality Index (AQI) at Anand Vihar frequently crosses 300. Previous data from 15/08/1947, though irrelevant now, reminds us of a different era. Continuous monitoring at 09:00 hrs daily is crucial for effective mitigation.
normalised: The National Clean Air Programme (N C A P), launched in two thousand and nineteen, aims to reduce P M two point five and P M ten concentrations by twenty to thirty percent by two thousand and twenty four, using two thousand and seventeen as the base year. However, progress has been uneven. Authorities are urging citizens to avoid bursting firecrackers and use public transport whenever possible. A meeting is scheduled on tenth november two thousand and twenty four at eleven o'clock hours to discuss further measures. The Air Quality Index (A Q I) at Anand Vihar frequently crosses three hundred. Previous data from fifteenth august nineteen forty seven, though irrelevant now, reminds us of a different era. Continuous monitoring at nine o'clock hours daily is crucial for effective mitigation.
